name: 4.19 "Dark Imaginings" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What song did Norm sing as part of the barber shop quartet?
questions.explanation:
Goodnight Ladies.

	"Goodnight Ladies" is a folk song believed to have been written by Edwin Pearce Christy. Norm did not stay with the barber shop quartet. He said it was his dream to sing with them, but after he sang that song, his dream was fulfilled and he went back to drinking beer.

questions.text: Who did Cliff say his turnip looked like?
questions.explanation:
June Lockhart.

	June Lockhart was the mother on "Lassie". Cliff was explaining how the turnip looked like June Lockhart when he realized that he was starting to get weird.

questions.text: Who was the woman Sam went out with that was younger than him?
questions.explanation:
Bonnie.

	Bonnie was played by Pamela Bach-Hasselhoff. At the time of the show she had not yet married David Hasselhoff; they did later marry and divorce.

questions.text: Who won in racketball, Sam or Woody?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam was quite a bit older than Woody. While he won, it caused Sam some great pain.

questions.text: What did Diane say was her worst fear?
questions.correct: No hotels had Sam registered as a guest.
questions.explanation:
No hotels had Sam registered as a guest.

	When Sam didn't return after he and Woody played racketball, she started to get worried. She called all the hotels and even looked him up under his alternate names.

questions.text: By what name did Cliff call his cornstalk?
questions.explanation:
Meryl Streep.

	Frasier had been treating Cliff and it appeared to be working. However, when Cliff got a bill from Frasier, he pulled out a cornstalk and called it Meryl Streep.

Sam.

	Diane found out Sam was in the hospital when some nurses were at the bar talking about a patient hitting on them. Woody blamed himself for Sam being in the hospital.

questions.text: Why was the hospitalized person in the hospital?
questions.explanation:
hernia.

	Sam didn't want anyone to know he had a hernia because he felt like he was an old man. Carla told him that "Sam Malone does not age."

options: He can't get a date with any of the nurses.
questions.explanation:
He was getting older.

	Diane told him he couldn't accept getting old but needed to live each day to the fullest. She also told him that men get better looking with age.

questions.text: On what timeframe did the patient leave the hospital the first time?
questions.explanation:
early.

	Sam decided he was better despite what the doctors said. However, when Woody hit him on the backside, he said he very badly wanted to return to the hospital.
